task_description: Execute a complete multi-cloud deployment across AWS, Azure, and GCP. Deploy the core infrastructure in AWS with EKS cluster, set up Azure AKS for disaster recovery with cross-region replication, configure GCP GKE for specific workloads, implement Transit Gateway for AWS connectivity, set up VPN connections between clouds, configure global load balancing, and ensure consistent security policies across all clouds. Use Terraform modules for each cloud provider.
goal: Deploy and integrate infrastructure across AWS, Azure, and GCP with secure connectivity
expected_actions: Deploy AWS infrastructure with EKS using terraform/modules/aws/*
Set up Azure AKS cluster using terraform/modules/azure/*
Configure GCP GKE cluster using terraform/modules/gcp/*
Implement AWS Transit Gateway for VPC connectivity
Set up site-to-site VPNs between cloud providers
Configure cross-cloud network routing and security groups
Set up global DNS and load balancing
expected_outputs: EKS cluster active in AWS with node groups
AKS cluster running in Azure with system pools
GKE cluster operational in GCP with autopilot
evaluation_criteria: All three Kubernetes clusters are healthy
Security groups allow required traffic only
DNS resolution works across all clouds
hints: Use make commands in terraform/ directory for each cloud
Ensure consistent CIDR ranges across clouds
Configure kubectl contexts for all three clusters
Test connectivity with curl between clusters
